intro: Lepidium montanum subsp. heterophyllum, commonly known as the mountain cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous species. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its small, white flowers are arranged in racemes, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Lepidium montanum subsp. heterophyllum is often found in open meadows and along stream banks at high elevations.
